_AMT_em.description: The amount of AMTI exempted from AMT.

_SS_thd50.description: 50% of combined income in range starting at this threshold is subject to social security tax.
_SS_thd50.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 20a&b, calculation (Worksheet, add line 10 to line 8 amounts.)

_SS_thd85.description: 50% of combined income in range starting at this threshold is subject to social security tax.
_SS_thd85.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 20a&b, calculation (Worksheet, add line 10 values to line 8).

_ACTC_rt.description: AKA rate for refundable portion of CTC; Apply this rate to earned income in excess of $3000*, to get the ACTC amount, which is capped at the amount of unclaimed nonrefundable CTC.

_STD_Aged.description: Add this value to regular standard deduction to get standard deduction for aged individual.
_STD_Aged.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 40, calculation (the difference of the two tables given in the instruction).

_AMT_Child_em.long_name: Child AMT Exemption Additional Income Base
_AMT_Child_em.description: Add this amount to one child's income to get the total income base for exemption.

_AMT_tthd.description: This threshold separates the 26%* and 28%* AMT tax rates: in order to get tentative minimum tax, income below this level is subject to 26% tax rate and above this level subject at 28%.

_II_em.description: Personal exemption is equal to this amount; Dependency exemption is equal to this amount mutiplied by the number of qualified dependents.

_KT_c_Age.long_name: Maximum Age subject to Kiddie Tax
_KT_c_Age.description: Under this age, the individual is subject to either AMT or Kiddie Tax.

_AMT_em_pe.long_name: AMT Exemption Phaseout ending AMTI (Married filling Separately)
_AMT_em_pe.description: Individuals with married filing separately need to add extra amount to AMTI beyond this AMTI level

_CTC_c.long_name: Max Child Tax Credit per child

_EITC_InvestIncome_c.description: The earned income credit may not be claimed by taxpayers whose investment income exceeds this limit.

_ACTC_Income_thd.description: The portion of earned income below this threshold does not count as base for earned income credit.

_ETC_pe_Single.description: The education tax credit will be zero for those tax payers of single filing status with modified AGI level (in thousands) higher than this level.

_ETC_pe_Married.description: The education tax credit will be zero for those tax payers of married filing status with modified AGI level (in thousands) higher than this level.

_FEI_ec_c.description: This amount is the maximum foreign earned income one individual could exclude from gross income.

_EITC_ps_MarriedJ.long_name: EITC Phastout Starting* AGI (Married filling Jointly)
_EITC_ps_MarriedJ.description: Starting: this amount the difference between the phaseout starting AGI of taxpayers with filling status of married filling jointly and other filling status (single, surviving spouse or head of household);  This amount can also apply to the phaseout ending AGI.
_EITC_ps_MarriedJ.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 66a&b, calcuation (the difference btw EIC phaseout bases of married jointly fillers and other fillers).

_LLC_Expense_c.description: The maximum expense eligible for lifetime learning credit.

_CDCC_crt.long_name: Maximum Child and Dependent Care Credit Rate
_CDCC_crt.description: This rate is the maximum rate that applied on AGI for child and dependent care credit; This rate decreases as AGI goes up.

_ID_ps.description: Itemized deduction will be zero for taxpayers with income higher than this level.

_EITC_prt.description: Earned income credit will decrease at the this rate when earned income goes up in the phaseout range.

_SS_Income_c.long_name: Max Taxable AGI for Social Security
_SS_Income_c.description: Taxpayers with income higher than this maximum are not subjected to social security tax.

_EITC_ps.description: Beyond this level of AGI, the amount of EITC starts to decrease as AGI goes up..

_AMT_em_ps.description: AMT exemption starts to decrease when AMTI goes beyond this threshold.
_AMT_em_ps.irs_ref: Form 1040, line 45, instruction (Worksheet). Or else form 6251, line 20, instruction

_CTC_ps.description: Child tax credit begins to decrease when taxpayers MAGI goes above this level.

_NIIT_thd.description: If the amount of your wages, self-employment income and railroad retirement compensation is more than this threshold, you are subject to the additional medicare tax at 0.9%.

_II_em_ps.description: Personal exemption starts to decrease beyond this income level.

_FICA_ss_trt.description: social security  tax rate, including both employer and employee
_FICA_ss_trt.notes: We do not calculate payroll tax liability, but use this for eligibility for some tax items.

_FICA_mc_trt.description: medicare tax rate, including both employer and employee
_FICA_mc_trt.notes: We do not calculate payroll tax liability, but use this for eligibility for some tax items.

_SS_percentage1.description: This percentage of income in range 25k - 34k is taxable for the filing status of Single under current law
_SS_percentage1.irs_ref: Form 1040, instructions, Lines 20a&b, social security benefits worksheet, line 2

_SS_percentage2.description: This percentage of income in range 34k+ is taxable for the filing status of Single under current law
_SS_percentage2.irs_ref: Form 1040, instructions, Lines 20a&b, social security benefits worksheet

_II_prt.description: Personal Exemption amount will decrease by this rate for each dollar of AGI exceeding certain thresholds.
_II_prt.irs_ref: IRS publication 17, Section 3, Worksheet for Determining the Deduction for Exemptions, Line 7

_ID_Medical_frt.long_name: Itemized Deduction: Medical Deduction Floor (%, floor)
_ID_Medical_frt.description: You are eligible to deduct your medical expense when it exceeds this percentage of AGI.

_ID_Casualty_frt.long_name: Itemized Deduction: Casualty Deduction Floor (%, floor)
_ID_Casualty_frt.description: The deductable amount of casualty loss would be the portion exceeding this percentage of AGI.

_ID_Miscellaneous_frt.long_name: Itemized Deduction: Miscellaneous Deduction Floor(%, AGI)
_ID_Miscellaneous_frt.description: The deductable amount of miscellaneous itemized deduction is the portion of expense exceeding this percentage of AGI.

_ID_Charity_crt_Cash.long_name: Itemized Deduction: Charity Deduction ceiling for Cash (%, AGI)
_ID_Charity_crt_Cash.description: The deduction for Charity in form of cash is capped at this percentage of AGI.

_ID_Charity_crt_Asset.long_name: Itemized Deduction: Charity Deduction ceiling for Asset (%, AGI)
_ID_Charity_crt_Asset.description: The deduction for Charity contributed in the form of assets is capped at this percentage of AGI.

_ID_prt.description: Your itemized deduction amount will be reduced at this rate for each dollar exceeding certain thresholds. This reduction is capped at 80% of total itemized deduction under the current law.
_ID_prt.irs_ref: IRS publication 17, section 29,'How do you figure out the limit?'

_ID_crt.long_name: Maximum Percentage for Phaseout amount of Itemized Deduction
_ID_crt.description: The phaseout amount is capped at this percentage of total deduction amount. The phaseout does not apply to deductions on medical expenses, investment interest, casualty and threft losses and wagering losses
_ID_crt.irs_ref: IRS publication 17, section 29,'How do you figure out the limit?'

_NIIT_trt.description: AKA Unearned Income Medicare Distribution Tax. Taxed on net investment income of individuals with MAGI higher than certain thresholds.

_AMT_prt.description: AMT exemtion will decrease by this amount for each dollor exceeding certain AMTI thresholds.

_AMT_trt1.long_name: AMT rate for AMTI under the threshold
_AMT_trt1.description: The tax rate applied to the portion of AMT income below the threshold.

_AMT_trt2.long_name: Additional AMT rate for AMTI above the threshold
_AMT_trt2.description: Add this rate to the tax rate for AMT income under the threshold to get the actual above threshold tax rate.
_AMT_trt2.irs_ref: Form 6251, line 31, inline, calculation: subtract rates
_AMT_trt2.notes: This is the additional tax rate (on top of .26) for AMT income above certain threshold

_CTC_prt.description: The amount of credit starts to decrease after MAGI hits certain threshold, at this rate.
_CTC_prt.irs_ref: Form 1040, instructions, Child Tax Credit Worksheet, line 5

_ACTC_ChildNum.long_name: Additional Child Tax Credit Qualified Children Number
_ACTC_ChildNum.description: Only families with this number of qualified children or more, are qualified for additional child tax credit

_ALD_StudentLoan_HC.long_name: Hair Cut on Student Loan Interest Deduction
_ALD_StudentLoan_HC.description: This pencentage can be applied to reduce the student loan interest deduction. Student loan interest is deducted at full amount from gross income.
_ALD_StudentLoan_HC.notes: The deduction amount will be (1- Hair Cut) * Student Loan Interest.

_ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_HC.long_name: Hair Cut on Deduction for self-employment tax
_ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_HC.description: This percentage reduces the employer equivalent portion of self-employment deduction before AGI.
_ALD_SelfEmploymentTax_HC.notes: The final deduction amount would be (1 - Hair Cut) * Self Employment Tax Deduction

_ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_HC.long_name: Hair Cut on Deduction for Self Employed Health Insurance
_ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_HC.description: This percentage reduces the health insurance deduction for self-employed taxpayers.
_ALD_SelfEmp_HealthIns_HC.notes: The final deduction amount would be (1 - Hair Cut) * Current deduction for self employed health insurance.

_ALD_KEOGH_SEP_HC.long_name: Hair Cut on Deduction for Payment to either KEOGH or SEP plan
_ALD_KEOGH_SEP_HC.description: The percentage you can impose to reduce deductions for Keogh or SEP plan payments. Under the current law, payments to Keogh or SEP plans can be fully deducted from gross income.
_ALD_KEOGH_SEP_HC.notes: The final deduction amount is (1 - Hair Cut) * KEOGH/SEP plan payments

_ALD_EarlyWithdraw_HC.long_name: Hair Cut on Forfeited Interest Penalty
_ALD_EarlyWithdraw_HC.description: You can reduce this percentage of early withdraw penalty dedeuction from adjustments. Under the current law, early withdraw penalty can be fully deducted from gross income.

_ALD_Alimony_HC.description: The percentage you can impose to reduce Alimony Payments adjustment amount. Under the current law, the full amount of alimony payment is taken as a deduction from gross income in arriving at AGI.
_ALD_Alimony_HC.notes: The final adjustment amount would be (1 - Hair Cut) * Alimony Payments

_CDCC_ps.long_name: Child and Dependent Care Credit phaseout start
_CDCC_ps.description: For taxpayers with AGI over this amount, the credit, under the current law, is reduced by one percentage point each $2000 of AGI over this amount.

_switch_MUI.long_name: Switch for additional medicare tax on Unearned income
